intro: Pedicularis tsoongii, commonly known as the Chinese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
